name: Cumbria Day Ranger
description:
CUMBRIA DAY RANGER Unlimited travel for one day throughout Cumbria extending to Dumfries and Lockerbie in the north, Haltwhistle and Skipton in the east, Preston in the south and to Heysham, 
      Morecambe and the Cumbrian coast line in the west. You can alight at Ravenglass and visit the Ravenglass & Eskdale Railway, a 10% discount is available off single and return fares.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £58.20 child (5-15): £29.10 16-17 saver: £29.10 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V : £38.75 FF H V child fare: £11.05 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £55.60 2023 - £53.00 2022 - £50.00 2021 - £47.20 2020 - £47.20 2019 - £45.90 2018 - £44.50 2014 - £40.50 2011 - £36.00 time restrictions Valid anytime but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 train operating companies Avanti West Coast, Northern, ScotRail, TransPennine Express purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities

stations: Morecambe Nethertown Oxenholme Lake District Parton
